Signal Messenger

Keep your phone number private with Signal usernames

Signal‚Äôs mission and sole focus is private communication. For years, Signal has kept your messages private, your profile information (like your name and profile photo) private, your contacts private, and your groups private ‚Äì among much else. Now...

posts.name: Navneet Vikram Tey
posts.cooked:
Ah, need to wait for the next SOON joke.

The work put behind it was worth the wait. All cases were clearly thought out, you get username/Qr code/link to share with friends. I mean I thought i will catch bugs and add feature request, but honestly it‚Äôs just awesome.
Also supported by the unofficial Signal CLI now: v0.13.0 ¬∑ AsamK/signal-cli ¬∑ Discussion #1458 ¬∑ GitHub

posts.name: Klint
posts.cooked:
Great news! Thanks
One question though: what about someone who does not want to update his app, staying on or installing a 6.x version to see all phone numbers?
Will 6.x versions be blocked at some point?
Are safety numbers automatically verified if I scan a friends username QR code?
They are verified but I wouldn‚Äôt call scanning an automatic verification.

Part of the point of using safety numbers is to use a second channel to verify that the person with whom you are communicating via Signal is the intended person. If you post your QR code on a website, then someone hacks the website and only replaces the QR code, the person who scanned it would be communicating with the hacker.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.0 release
Adding contact by qr-code should verify safety number

posts.cooked: Each version of Signal expires after 90 days. So yes, they will be blocked eventually.

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: also, I don‚Äôt think that even from a technical standpoint they can be verified from the QR code. safety number QRs contain the identities of both parts of the conversation, while the username QR only contains one.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.0 release
Adding contact by qr-code should verify safety number
Adding contact by qr-code should verify safety number

posts.cooked:
From the blog post:

Usernames in Signal are designed to be easily changeable. For example, you can make a username to connect with people at a conference or to plan a group trip. Then, when it‚Äôs over, change it if you want to. Just click on your username from your Profile Details page to make the changes you want.

Let‚Äôs take the conference example. Let‚Äôs assume that I connected with some people, by giving them my username X. Then after the conference, I change my username to Y. Will the people who started conversations with me based on my username X still be able talk to me, after I changed my username to Y?
Yes, they will, since the username is only used to establish a first connection (and get an identifier which is used for all communication beyond that), so to say.
I assume that hiding phone numbers and opting out of contact discovery works even if other users have older versions of Signal, right?

posts.name: Talya (she/her)
posts.cooked: yes. as with message editing, the receive for all of these things was turned on long ago.

What if I didn‚Äôt want to let my contacts know that I signed up for Signal, but they instead had the active notification about the contacts joining Signal?

Are these new features good for this ?

Then I don‚Äôt understand this:

‚Äú Selecting ‚ÄúNobody‚Äù means that if someone enters your phone number on Signal, they will not be able to message or call you, or even see that you‚Äôre on Signal.

If your friend downloads Signal and opens the app to see who they can message, they won‚Äôt know that they can message you. Instead, in order to connect on Signal you will need to share your full, unique username with them.‚Äú
